page.title: 13TEMPLETON LADIES' CLUBS.
page.content: Templeton Ladies' Choir and the Folk Dancing Club were founded by Mrs.Peggy Morgan, who owns and runs the village Post Office.The Ladies' Choir started in 1974.There are 38 members and they meet every Thursday from 7.30pm until 9.00pm.The Choir gives many concerts and has performed at Swansea Hospital. The Folk Dancing Club is held on Wednesday from 8.00pm to 10.00pm.Peggy Morgan founded it in 1982. About 13 people attend every week. The ages range from 30 to 60 years.The ladies wear Welsh National Costume when they do Welsh Folk Dancing. They practise in the Chapel Hall. They make their own costumes.They enter competitions in Pembrokeshire.In 1983 they performed in Medieval costumes in the Tenby and Saundersfoot Lions' Summer Spectacular Show on Carew Airfield. .
